messages.content: Do you feel the company supports mental health openly?
I think the intent is there, we have EAPs and wellness days, but the culture still glorifies overworking. If leadership took a stand on balance, it’d normalize using those benefits.
Have you experienced or witnessed any inappropriate behavior at work?

I did witness a situation where a team member made repeated sarcastic comments toward a female colleague during meetings. She brushed it off publicly, but I could tell it made her uncomfortable. I’m not sure if it was escalated formally, but I do think the manager should’ve intervened.
Have you ever struggled to get clarity on a policy?
Yes, during COVID, there was a lot of confusion about work-from-home allowances. HR gave conflicting answers and that created unnecessary tension.
Have you ever considered taking a mental health day?
Yes, and I’ve taken one or two. Thankfully, my manager was understanding. But I didn’t feel comfortable announcing it as a mental health day — I just said I wasn’t feeling well.
Have you ever felt overlooked or dismissed by your manager?
Once or twice, yes, especially during performance reviews where I felt my input wasn’t fully considered.
Do you feel supported in your role by your manager?
Yes, my manager has my back when it counts. They’re willing to step in when things escalate and always try to unblock me.
Any final advice for the organization?
Listen more deeply to employee feedback and don’t wait until someone resigns to ask how they’re doing.
Do you feel emotionally safe in your current team environment?
For the most part, yes. We share laughs, celebrate wins, and I can be myself without judgment. But I do wish there was more openness about failures or asking for help.
Have you ever felt a policy was unfair or biased?
Yes, the current promotion policy seems to favor people in client-facing roles over backend teams, regardless of contribution.
Were you satisfied with the outcome?
No. I didn’t get the hike I expected, and there was no clarity on what to do differently.
What could we have done to make you stay?
A clearer growth path and more structured career conversations could have made a big difference. Also, more openness to internal transfers.
How are you coping with work-related stress?
I’ve developed my own coping mechanisms, like setting strict boundaries after hours and taking short walks during the day. But sometimes, the stress catches up, especially when deadlines overlap.
